caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 63–68.
Coelotes pseudoterrestris Schenkel 1963
, female holotype (63–65) and male paratype (66–68) of
C. sacratus Wang et al. , 1990
from Kunming. 63,66 Habitus, dorsal view; 64,67 Eyes, view between front and dorsal; 65,68 Labia, ventral view.

FIGURES 69– 73.
Coelotes pseudoterrestris Schenkel 1963
, from Tengchong County, Henghe (CAS, CASENT9020441). 69,70 Epigynum, ventral and dorsal view; 71–73 Palp, prolateral, ventral and retrolateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis: This species resembles
C. thailandensis
in having the short, laterally arising epigynal teeth, similar atrium, anteriorly extending copulatory ducts and similar palp, but can be distinguished by the distinctly extending, folding copulatory ducts (as long as spermathecal length), strongly pointed distal end of patellar apophysis, and long, slender conductor which is longer than its dorsal apophysis (
Figs 49–57
).

Notes: Female epigynal teeth vary slightly in length but are consistently arising anteriorly lateral to atrium, slightly posterior of anterior atrial margin, widely separated by slightly more than atrial width. Atrium also varies in size and shape from having a wide to a narrow anterior atrial margin. Copulatory ducts are consistently long, extending anteriorly, slightly folding longitudially but may vary in size and shape. Considering the variation in epigynal teeth, atrium, copulatory ducts and the different shapes of spermathecae, in addition to the widespread occurrence, there might be more than one species involved but the lack of sufficient male and female specimens from additional localities prevents us from making a more detailed hypothesis.
